Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: JParker800
Reviews.Content: I would definately recommend the Triada Hotel to people visiting Istanbul. First of all I'd advise people to stay in the BeyoÄŸlu-area when visiting Istanbul. There's lots to see and do in the Sultanahmet area, but I personally would not enjoy staying there. There are also lots and lots of great cafes, restaurants and bars in BeyoÄŸlu, and Triada is close to many of them. This hotel is small, and consists of 11 rooms. I suspect the top floor penthouse is exceptional, the other rooms look pretty much like you would expect from the pictures. We had a backside room with no view, but the jacuzzi made up for the lack of scenery. If you have a room in the other side of the hotel, you'll have a view but also a lot of noise from the busy Istiklal street, so I'd rather go for a quiet room. Service was good, very friendly and attentive but not everyone was great at speaking english. They also offered to send a shuttle service to pick us up at the airport, but at 30 euros that was far too expensive, as a regular taxi should only cost 30-50 turisk liras. Only thing that was a little bothersome was that it's not very soundproof, so arguments from other rooms could get pretty annoying... Oh, and like other commenters point out: just skip the hotel breakfast and go to one of the nearby cafes and get yourself some food. Overall, great location, good service, clean and comfortable rooms. And at that price? Most recommended.

Reviews.Title: “jakuzi”
Reviews.Author: Spekt
Reviews.Content: you can not find a room with jakuzi in istanbul with this price range the hotel is 10 seconds away from istiklal street. i stayed for one night and loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect value boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kajaam
Reviews.Content: The Triada hotel has a great location on a side street off the lively shopping street of Taksim, close to the square, restaurants and pubs. You can probably hear music from the disco across the street on weekends but for the most part, it's quiet. The rooms are beautifully decorated (ours had paintings from Klimt), clean and spacious. The most wonderful feature of the Triada has to be the staff which was pleasant, friendly and helpful. From the reception desk attendant to the lovely lady setting up the breakfast table. They went out of their way to make sure that we were comfortable, answered all our questions and made wonderful suggestions on where to eat and shop. My only complaint about this lovely hotel is the fact that breakfast is limited. Otherwise, I would not mind staying at the Triada again.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we needed!!!”
Reviews.Author: PeggyR3
Reviews.Content: The hotel was exactly at the center of everything. Istiklal str- The shopping street!!!- is 4 seconds away. Taksim square-where metro and buses and tram begin- is1 minute away. All kinds of restaurants are nearby. The residence is in excellent condition.11 rooms only, so it was like we were home. Everything in the hotel is new. Great matresses and great jacuzzi in the room (not in all rooms).The stuff was great and helpfull. We booked a room in the back side which has got no view AT ALL but it's extremely quite-exactly what you need after a full day walking around a city like this. You need to sleep, you don't want to sit outside in the balcony. The only thing that was poor was the brakfast but with a hundred places around to eat, you don't need the breakfast. I will go there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Triada became clean but extremely expensive”
Reviews.Author: hanzzen79
Reviews.Content: They doubled the price and now it is clean and new but return of investment is poor. Breakfast minimum standard with howling tv in the background noisy road all night: not worth the money anymore. I used to stay there before and the price was 80, became now 160 euro for the double

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the website!”
Reviews.Author: britbolly
Reviews.Content: This place was nothing like the image it portrays on the website. The rooms have got shabby. The cookers have been removed from the rooms. The roof terrace is only available for the "penthouse". The sauna was being used as a storeroom and you have to pay extra to use it. There are no computers in the rooms. Don't believe the hype!

Reviews.Title: “It was not a hotel-residence, just another hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wisefamilybackpack
Reviews.Content: After days and nights of searching for a place to stay in Istanbul, we settled for the Triada Residence & Boutique Hotel because it boasted a kitchenette. With our 7 years old, we did not want to have to go to the restaurant twice a day for 8 days. Actually the kitchenette was no more that a tea making facility and a small fridge. There was no natural light in the room as its only window gave onto the huge air conditioning block. This was no good value for money any longer. In the morning, we therefore got up and ready as soon as possible to enjoy breakfast downstairs...but there was no dining room! Fortunately the very friendly receptionist kindly organised for us to have breakfast at a cafe nearby! After protesting for the room, we were offered the 'executive suite' for a modest supplement. However, there was only 2 single beds, still no facility to cook or heat up food and the no shade on the terrace. That's a shame as there was potential for this room but it was not well used.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: ferozde
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Triada residence and I really liked it. Best location and excellent friendly staff . Clean,big and comfortable rooms.Just few minutes walking distance to Taksim square and best restaurant, cafes and Metro-bus stations.I recommend with violently for everyone.
